alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; St. Charles; St. John The Baptist (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 1:24PM CDT until August 10 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, Jefferson, St. Charles and St. John The Baptist. * WHEN...Until 430 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 124 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hahnville, Laplace, New Sarpy, Destrehan, Norco, St. Rose, Taft, Ama, Montz, Luling and Killona. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Jefferson; St. Charles; St. John The Baptist
